name: Liliana Florea
content: florealab.org Our group is developing accurate and efficient algorithms and software tools to analyze next generation sequencing data and answer questions in biology and medicine. Through tool development and analyses, we work to comprehensively characterize alternative splicing landscape in different organisms and cellular conditions, and to identify markers of disease. We design tools to help discover features of pathogen virulence and adaptation and to characterize the changes in the host environment in response to infection. About us Our group is developing computational methods to model and solve problems in biology and medicine, fueled by the wealth of sequence data generated by new and evolving sequencing technologies. We design accurate and efficient algorithms and software tools to tackle current problems in genome assembly, gene and alternative splicing annotation, microRNA genomics and host-pathogen interaction, and apply them to characterize the genetic and genomic landscape of different cellular states and different organisms. Find out more about our methods at our GitHub Splicebox repository and from our Software pages. Our work is currently being supported by NIH grant R35GM156374 and NSF award DBI-2504115.
